body_html:
Still no success on my machine. I tried to do a rigorous reinstall, in short:

  • Old setup: Python and CUDA via windows installers and tensorflow-gpu via pip. I removed all those, (including left over environment paths, files of cudnn and all python site-packages).
  • New setup: I updated NVIDIA graphics driver and installed miniconda.

Using different conda environments, my code works in TF 1.8, but in TF 1.9 and 1.11 still not.

  • If this is an installation issue, what files could there be still on my system?
  • Could this be a hardware issue? Can my error be reproduced on a Quadro M2200? @ymodak I guess you used a different GPU?
body_text:
Still no success on my machine. I tried to do a rigorous reinstall, in short:

Old setup: Python and CUDA via windows installers and tensorflow-gpu via pip. I removed all those, (including left over environment paths, files of cudnn and all python site-packages).
New setup: I updated NVIDIA graphics driver and installed miniconda.

Using different conda environments, my code works in TF 1.8, but in TF 1.9 and 1.11 still not.

If this is an installation issue, what files could there be still on my system?
Could this be a hardware issue? Can my error be reproduced on a Quadro M2200? @ymodak I guess you used a different GPU?
body:
Still no success on my machine. I tried to do a rigorous reinstall, in short: 
  - Old setup: Python and CUDA via windows installers and tensorflow-gpu via pip. I removed all those, (including left over environment paths, files of cudnn and all python site-packages). 
   - New setup: I updated NVIDIA graphics driver and installed miniconda. 

Using different conda environments, my code works in TF 1.8, but in TF 1.9 and 1.11 still not. 
- If this is an installation issue, what files could there be still on my system?
- Could this be a hardware issue? Can my error be reproduced on a Quadro M2200? @ymodak I guess you used a different GPU?
